p: In the early colonial period, administrative and trading posts were founded, with frequent steamer or railway connections to cities. Although their permanent population was no larger than that of a village, they had a high turnover of predominantly male passers-by, consisting of soldiers, traders, porters, and laborers. As happened in cities, generalized social disruption ensued in the colonial posts and enterprises located in the interior, and sex work and syphilis flourished [ 72, 105, 141, 142, 143, 150].
